title: Sun Valley Nordic Fest Downtown Jam
course: Closed Course. Groomed Snow 1/4 mile Trail
notes: Come Have Fun In The Snow On Your Fat Snow Bike!
directions: Directly West of Ketchum Post Office

title: 19th Annual Barking Spider Bash
description: Rolling terrain, desert scrub, sandy washes. Great early season opener and nearly 300 riders last year!
course: 10 mile course, nothing really technical. A roadie dream course.
registration: registration opens 10:30am on-site or www.spondoro.con for online pre-reg.
directions: Location: From Melba, go south on ID 45 to the junction with ID 78. Cross the Snake River and go about 0.7 miles, then 2 miles west on Upper Reynolds Creek Road to the staging area. Alternate trailheads include the Rabbit Creek trailhead and the Fossil Creek trailhead.

title: Big Nasty XC Adventure
description:
Time: Saturday, 11:00 am mud run, (3miles), Sunday, 11am mountain bike XC, (8 mile loop) Cost: $20-30 (includes event food and beverages, plus a T-shirt!)
Course: Tom Pence Ranch, on Big Willow Road, (take I-84 exit 13, follow signs, located 4 miles from New Plymouth, 45 miles from Boise, 11 miles from Ontario). Held at the beautiful, 1,000 acre Pence Ranch, the 3-mile mud run follows the river through woods and grasslands, crossing Big Willow Creek several times before heading to the top of the Big Nasty Hillclimb and then descending down a tight trail in a downhill canyon. Sunday’s 8-mile mountain bike loop uses some of the same bottom section as the mud run, then heads up into the hills for lots of rolling climbs and descents. It will be a very, very unique enjoyable course for riders of all abilities, with no huge climbs or descents.
course: Held at the beautiful, 1,000 acre Pence Ranch, the 3-mile mud run follows the river through woods and grasslands, crossing Big Willow Creek several times before heading to the top of the Big Nasty Hillclimb and then descending down a tight trail in a downhill canyon. Sunday’s 8-mile mountain bike loop uses some of the same bottom section as the mud run, then heads up into the hills for lots of rolling climbs and descents. It will be a very, very unique enjoyable course for riders of all abilities, with no huge climbs or descents.
registration:
ONLINE closes May 17th
Pro = $36
CAT-1-2-3 = $30
Under 18 and Trail blazer = $25 Runners = $25
INCLUDES a T-SHIRT!
directions: Coming from Boise head W on I-84, located at Tom Pence Ranch, on Big Willow Road, (taking I-84 exit 13, follow signs, located 4 miles from New Plymouth, 45 miles from Boise, 11 miles from Ontario).

title: Eagle bike park Super d, DH and Dual
description:
3 different individual downhill events, slalom on Saturday, Super d on Sunday and DOWNHILL on Monday! Awards to conclude events.
All events start at 12:30pm everyday!
course: head 2 head slalom, built by ECarter! sub2min course. Super D, around the whole park including tables, drops, berms and more! Downhill national qualifer, 2min course with gaps, ladder drops and rock gardens. Fun for everyone, not just the extreme racers.
registration:
Pro = $30
Cat 1,2,3-- Expert, Sport, Beginner = $25
Junior/Trailblazer = $20
bring $5 to pay for a 1-day
directions: Follow HWY 55 North from Boise. Hang a right on Floating Feather Rd. Then a left on Old Horsebend Rd. You will see the bikepark on the right side of road, just past the BMX track and Skate park.

title: Wood River Cup
registration: day of registration at event.  Closes 10 minutes before race
directions:
Croy weeks 1,3,5 3.5 miles out croy left on trailhead road
cutters weeks 2,4  head east on myrtle go through all stops to hillside registration at cuttrers park

title: Boise 2 Idaho City MTB TOUR
description: Mountain bike or cross bike fun tour. 90% dirt roads with a sweet single track finish in Idaho City. 1 or 2 day options. More than 40miles per day, lots of great climbing and descending opportunities.
course:
This adventure ride rolls up Rocky Canyon Rd., from there you\'ll visit two more high passes on your way to our lunch area located at Clear Creek Lodge. The lunch stop is our half-way point, located on Clear Creek Rd., if you drive you\'ll be turning left off Grimes Creek Rd from HWY 21.
After lunch, we proceed along scenic Grimes Creek Rd. North to Centerville. Following a snack break, you\'ll proceed to climb up to Spanish Fork and find the exhilerating descent into Idaho City. Finish for the 1st day is 100yds NWest from the football field, there you\'ll find our free, dry camping area in the trees. You can look forward to a GREAT dinner provided in the historical Park that evening. Free showers located at the High School in downtown Idaho City.
registration:
7am- Check in STARTS, at the staging area. Look for a car hauler to carry your camping gear. We are located at the Ft. Boise Armory on Reserve St. in Boise, Id.


ONLINE closes June 14
Two-Day preseason $100=after May 31 goes to $120
One-Day = $80, then $100
NO ONSITE REGISTRATION, thank you for pre-registering.
directions: Check-in is located at the Old Ft. Boise Armory, one-half mile off Fort St. on Reserve in Boise, Idaho. Staging area is at the same place, look for the cargo truck. Starting 8am. For those starting Halfway, meet at Clear Creek Lodge off HWY 21 at NOON, this is our lunch stop as well.

title: Eagle Rock Cycling Annual Club Century
BYRDS Junior Tour of Idaho Omnium
description: Junior Omnium including ITT, Road Race, Criterium

title: 5th annual Jug Mtn Ranch Race
description:
Here is Long Valley\'s latest contribution to a awesome line-up of outdoor adventures. Patrick Harper and David Carey (plus help from IMBA/CIMBA/SWIMBA, last season) at Jug Mtn. Ranch community have put together a truly stellar course. The mountain bike cross-country is using a similar 12-mile loop that starts and finishes at the clubhouse, that we used last year. This course has some really fun singletrack and two-track sections, as well as some gnarly, short climbs and descents. 
The Saturday XC MTB race starts 12:30pm. 
ATTENTION: All ENDURO racers will race on Sunday afternoon. SPECIAL Awards are given out to the fastest rider in XC and ENDURO in a All-Mtn catagory. So there is 1 combined champion for Pro, Cat.1, Cat.2, ect., ect., (male and female), plus awards for ENDURO top 3 in cat 1-2-3 and Pro and Juniors
Awards to follow at the clubhouse. Food and beverage available at a discount in the restaurant.

Stick around on Sunday and compete or just be a spectator and witness some high flyin action from our top regional riders. There is also a 10K and 10mile trail run that start on Sunday morning at 9am!
course:
Enduro riders tackle a similiar course as we had last year about 2.5 mi. long! Plus there is a medium peddlers course and a 3rd course that is short,and mostly downhill.There is a very short, grunt climb at the end of every course that finishes at the clubhouse. The mountain bike cross-country is using a similar 12-mile loop that starts and finishes at the clubhouse, that we used last year. This course has some really fun singletrack and two-track sections, as well as some gnarly, short climbs and descents. 
The trail runners use the MTB XC course for their 10mi jount or make the short cut for 10K.
registration:
Our premiere single-track course in Central Idaho, as well as U.S.Nationals qualifying EVENT*. You can buy a day license if you just want to compete, but you must possess an annual license, to qualify for Nationals. *Riders may qualify here at Jug Mtn to race at the National Championships. Male Pro (Elite), Category 1: 15-18, 19-29, 30-39, 40+ Junior: 14 & under Female Pro (Elite) Category 1, 2, 3 (all ages) also qualified here, are Male Cat 2 and Cat 3 (all ages)

Prices include free adult beverages and powerfood for the race.

Pro= $40
Cat 1-2-3 = $36
Trailblazer = $20
one day insurance is $5

Runners are $25
directions: Follow HWY 55 North from Boise to Lake Fork, Id. Turn Right and proceed to the entrance of Jug Mtn. Ranch. Follow the signs to the clubhouse at the base of the Jughandle Mountain

title: Idaho State Championship Individual Time Trial
Bald Juan Cross Country Mt. Bike Race
Biggest Show in Idaho Circuit Race
2013 USA Cycling Marathon Mountain Bike Nationals
St. Lukes Sports Medicine Idaho State Criterium C
50 Miles at 4th of July

address.street: Bicycle Sales and Service, 1901 N. 4th Street

description: A fun mountain bike ride on double track and short single track trails through the Coeur d\'Alene Mountains. 5 aid stations along 4 different course distances with raffle, lunch, and ride souvenior at the finish.
course: Predominately double track with short single track connection sections. The 50 and 35 mile loops have challenging climbs with gorgeous scenery. The 10 and 17 mile courses are easier but will challenge the intermediate and beginner rider. Aid stations along the way will supply what you need if hungry or need repairs.
registration:
We encourage on-line registration at USA Cycling but, we have a hard copy flier at www.bicycleservice.com/4thJuly.html
You can also visit Bicycle Sales and Service at 1901 4th St. in Coeur d\'Alene, Idaho or call 208-667-8969 or e-mail bicyclesales@frontier.com for details.
directions: 4th of July Pass Nordic Ski Trailhead is conveniently located 15 miles east of Coeur d\'Alene, Idaho off Interstate 90. Maps and campgrounds can be found at the event website at www.bicycleservice.com/4thJuly.html

title: Tamarack Resort Bike Fest
description:
This is a great addition to the Wild Rockies series and Donnelly,Id. and it represents the progressive ideas of a sweet riding area and company known as Tamarack Resort. This XC course is loads of fun!! Look for the startline near the base of Tamarack Express. We'll start Saturday morning with the XC race at 11:30am. Stayed tuned to our Facebook page as we are looking to have some live music and other fun items in the line-up. 

We'll do awards at the base area with discount food and beverage to all the racers and families.Please join CIMBA and help us build more events and trails!
course:
XC-upper and lower mountain trails. 
DH-Looking at Rockstar and Stagefright, maybe using Hibernator if all goes well.
Enduro--similiar to last year with Super G, Hockey mom, Firebird, jumppark and maybe something new?? SmokeJumper??
registration:
Onsite Registration . YOU HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO REGISTER, BUT PLEASE dont show up late. REGISTRATION ONSITE, near the clubhouse, AFTER 10AM. FYI--- This is one of the final chances to gain valuable series points for the Wild Rockies Series Championship. 
Our online provider will be www.webscorer.com
notes: lodging available at the resort, please check for availability--www.tamarackidaho.com
directions: To get to the Startline, Go to HWY 55 North from Boise to Donnelly, Id. Turn left and proceed to follow the signs to the entrance of Tamarack Resort. Follow the signs to the lift parking at the base.

title: Dirt in your face warm up CX race
description:
Dirt in your face warm-up Cyclo-cross Race

Fun day of Cyclo-cross to get ready for the CX season
course: The course will a 2.5K loop on the Oakley Rodeo grounds, it will consists of gravel, dirt, and asphalt.
registration:
Each race will be $10 preregistration $15 day of race.
Kids race is free and juniors race is $5 preregistration and $10 day of entries will only be accepted from 9:00am to 10:00am Ribbons to all finishers of each race.
notes: The course will be an easy course to get warmed up for the Magic Valley Cyclo-cross series.
directions: From I-84 Take the Burley exit and head south 21 miles on Idaho Hwy 24 to Oakley, follow signs to the Rodeo grounds.

registration: pre reg online or day of
notes: Friday tt is optional.  results will be used to seed start grid Saturday
directions: turn east on Myrtle in Hailey take to the hillside follow signs
